channel.title: Amazing H-L2 Lego Set (Unfortunately Fan Made)
channel.description:
So it's not available for purchase.
I posted a couple of pics of this fellows (the talented ORRANGE) sets just before the forum crash, but I didn't know how many pics there were.
Here's a link to Kotaku's coverage of the set (pics therein).
[url]https://kotaku.com/5260293/yeah-lego-half+life-2-would-be-pretty-great[/url]

item.dc:creator: Leo99999
item.description:
saivert:

thx for necroposting. didn’t notice this thread before.
great lego sets.
and he could sell it if he didn’t label it as LEGO. LEGO doesn’t own all objects that can be put together. I’ve seen knock-offs before.

I think some of the suttf he uses is official LEGO tho so he will encounter problems there

Still, we can dream right?

item.title: Amazing H-L2 Lego Set (Unfortunately Fan Made)
item.dc:creator: Scorpion42
item.description:
popsUlfr:

Well, Star Wars wasn’t rated Mature or something as far as I know. If you sell a set about a game rated Mature, the Kids would want to associate it with something they don’t know about since they’re theoretically not allowed to play that Game (I know it would be naive to think they won’t play it anyway :3). That’s kind of problematic situation.

If only there were LEGO sets for adults :awesome: …

Then we could finally get our all yellow legowomen

EDIT: Yuck! Whats wrong with me? :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing H-L2 Lego Set (Unfortunately Fan Made)
item.dc:creator: InterloperX
item.description:
If he wanted to, but I don’t think he would make enough to cover the imminent lawsuit.

I resent that. LEGO is an art medium and also a plastic toy, but shit, you talk like you’ve got no talent and have to buy it.

This statement conveyed enough for me to address and clarify my stance.

And yes I am, not that it matters in the cyberscape.

/end troll

Read full topic

Also, please keep in mind normal, robot-like typing on the internet does not convey feelings or intention because you can’t inflict a tone of voice.

Unless you’re a badass. Are you a badass?

item.title: Amazing H-L2 Lego Set (Unfortunately Fan Made)
item.dc:creator: InterloperX
item.description:
I meant “Unfortunately fan made” in the sense that it would be illegal for ORRANGE to sell the sets. If it was licensed to Lego, I’d be putting in my order.

You should at least get some clarification before you “resent” someone, especially someone who has made many a soap carving of action figures that don’t exist.

Read full topic
item.source: Amazing H-L2 Lego Set (Unfortunately Fan Made)

item.title: Amazing H-L2 Lego Set (Unfortunately Fan Made)
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
LEGO is danish. Danes don’t care about video games. Despite all of their violent weapons and action themes, they have a strict Non-violent policy.

You can mold your own pices like headcrabs/helmets with a vacuum-form machine hooked up to a computer, or clay. This is how BrickArmsare made, which are the weapons you see here.

You can buy decals and print designs onto them to apply to your minifigs.

“Unfortunately Fan Made”? I resent that. LEGO is an art medium and also a plastic toy, but shit, you talk like you’ve got no talent and have to buy it.

Read full topic
item.source: Amazing H-L2 Lego Set (Unfortunately Fan Made)
